greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of even semiprimes dividing n.
comment: Also the number of prime divisors p|n such that n/p is even. - _Gus Wiseman_, Jun 06 2018
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(2n) = omega(n), a(2n+1) = 0, where omega(n) is the number of distinct prime divisors of n, A001221. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jun 09 2006
a(n) = card { d | d*p = n, d even, p prime }. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 30 2012
O.g.f.: Sum_{p prime} x^(2p)/(1 - x^(2p)). - _Gus Wiseman_, Jun 06 2018
program: return add(1-(n/d)%2 for d in divisors(n) if is_prime(d))
print([A106404(n) for n in (1..105)])  # Peter Luschny, Jan 30 2012
a106404 n = length [d | d <- takeWhile (<= n) a100484_list, mod n d == 0]
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 02 2005
